Linear regression y on x and x on y

25 Nov 2015

For two variables X and Y, is it equivalent to model their relation by either or ? In the first model, we consider Y as the independent variable and X as the dependent variable. In the second model, we switch X and Y.

The answer is no.

For the first model , the least square estimate is (in matrix form) . However, for second model , the least square estimate is . Generally, and are not the same. Intuitively, in the X-Y plot (Y is on the y-axis and X is on the x-axis), the least square estimate of model is to minimize the vertical distance (along y-axis) between the data and the fitted line. However, for the second model , it minimizes the horizontal distance (along x-axis). Therfore, the estimates are not the same.
